info.title: Huma Platform Play
info.description:
Welcome to API documentation for **Platform Play** product. Download the spec [here](./documentations.json).

### Introduction
This API is written in **OpenAPI v3** and is based on existing functionalities of [Huma Portal](https://info.huma.com/clinician-portal-guide) And [Huma App](https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/huma/id1519444604).

### Authentication
There are two ways to authenticate to the API:
- End user authentication: Using username, password flow. It may ask to setup 2FA based of deployment configuration.
- Machine user authencation: Using [Hawk](https://blog.mozilla.org/services/2015/02/05/whats-hawk-and-how-to-use-it/) method to authenticate into system.

For Hawk authentication, Huma staffs provides you with the necessary credentials.

#### Python / export de-identified data
  Download from the export.py file [here](./pyexample/export.py). Make sure to have python3 (>= 3.7) and pip on your system.

  1. Install dependencies:
    
     `$ pip install requests mohawk`
  

  2. Set AUTH_ID, AUTH_KEY, DEPLOYMENT_ID in code and call export.py:

     `$ python3 export.py`

  3. Or alternatively to step 2, set the env variable and call export.py:

     `$ AUTH_ID=<ID> AUTH_KEY=<KEY> DEPLOYMENT_ID=<DEP_ID> python3 export.py`
  
  Step 2 or 3 generates an export.json based on the input parameters.

#### Note
OpenAPI syntax we use a few [vendor extensions](https://github.com/Redocly/redoc/blob/master/docs/redoc-vendor-extensions.md).

tags.name: Export
tags.description: Export module is used by clinicians to export the patient data in CSV/JSON format.

post.description:
The users with any these roles can access the export API: `Admin`, `OrganizationStaff`, `AccessController` and `Contributor`

###### If you are using End user authentication

  1. **Sign in for clinician user:**
      - API `/api/auth/{version}/signin` will return the `authToken` and `user_id` in response.
  2. **Get deploymentId:**
      - Using the `Bearer {authToken}` do call `/api/extensions/{version}/user/{user_id}/configuration` to get `deploymentId`
  3. **Export patients data in CSV/JSON format(for that clinician):**
      - For given `deploymentId` the data can be exported using `/api/extensions/{version}/export/`

###### If you are using Hawk authentication

  1. **Sign in Api Key and Api ID:** 
        - Huma staffs provides you with Api credentials
  2. **Get deploymentId:**
        - Huma staffs provides you with necessary deployment ID(s)
  3. **Export patients data in CSV/JSON format:**
        - For given `deploymentId` the data can be exported using `/api/extensions/{version}/export/`

401.description: Unauthorized - `10001` While passing expired bearer token in header

403.description: Forbidden - `100003` While passing invalid value to any object

message.example: Field [ExportUsersRequestObject.deIdentified] with value [false] is not type of [bool]

404.description: Not found - `100003` While export profile does not exist

message.example: Export profile None does not exist

post.description:
Using Export Profile API endpoint you can perform basic CRUD operations against Export Profile data 


For example, To export the data using created export profile we can call below APIs: 

 1. **Create export profile for patients(for that clinician)/deployments(for that organization) data :** 

 - For given `deploymentId/organizationId`, `content` and `name` the export profile can be created using `/api/extensions/{version}/export/profile` 

 2. **Export patients/deployments data in CSV/JSON format(for that clinician/organization) by using created profile:** 

 - For given `baseProfile` and `deploymentId/organizationId` the data can be exported using `/api/extensions/{version}/export/`

400.description: Bad request - `900001` While passing already existed profile name

message.example: Profile with that name already exists.

401.description: Unauthorized - `10001` While passing expired bearer token in header

403.description: Forbidden - `100003` While passing invalid value to any object

message.example: Field [ExportUsersRequestObject.deIdentified] with value [false] is not type of [bool]

deIdentified.description:
Identified information type:
   * `true` - excluding identified information
   * `false` - including identified information

deploymentIds.description: Export data from multiple deployments by its `deploymentIds`

userIds.description: Export data only for specific users specified by thier `id`

moduleNames.description: Export only specific modules specific by module names

excludedModuleNames.description: Export all modules but not these

includeUserMetaData.description:
User's meta data type:
   * `true` - excluding user's meta data
   * `false` - including user's meta data

includeNullFields.description:
* `true` - Include fields which have null values
* `false` - Remove fields which have null values

useFlatStructure.description:
* `true` - Will use flat structure.
* `false` - Will use hierarchical structure.

view.description:
Export the data according to the selected view.
  * `"USER"` - Per user (user data will be first on the CSV/JSON)
  * `"DAY"` - Per date
  * `"MODULE_CONFIG"` - Per module

binaryOption.description:
Binary options type:
  * `"BINARY_INCLUDE"` - Include primitive's binaries
  * `"SIGNED_URL"` - Generate signed urls to download primitive's binaries
  * `"NONE"` - Keep as it is

layer.description:
Export files based on below layer type:
  * `"NESTED"` - Export files will be in the separate folders based on the view
  * `"FLAT"` - Export files will be in one folder based on the view

quantity.description:
Export files based on below quantity type:
  * `"MULTIPLE"` - Exported files will be in the separate files according to the module/day/user per file
  * `"SINGLE"` - Exported files should be in one file (CSV does not support single file option)

questionnairePerName.description:
* `true` - Split questionnaire primitives into separate files as per their name
* `false` - Can not split questionnaire primitives into separate files as per their name

splitMultipleChoice.description:
* `true` - Split multiple questionnaire choices based on a module config
* `false` - Can not split multiple questionnaire choices based on a module config

splitSymptoms.description:
* `true` - Split symptoms in CSV format
* `false` - Can not split symptoms in CSV format

translatePrimitives.description:
* `true` - Translate primitive values into keywords based on provided CSV in export deployment config
* `false` - Can not translate primitive values into keywords based on provided CSV in export deployment config

singleFileResponse.description:
* `true` - Get response into single file format (CSV/JSON)
* `false` - Get response into multiple files

translationShortCodesObjectFormat.description: Translation Short Codes Object files format

organizationId.description: Export data for specific organization by `organizationId`
Export data for specific organization by `organizationId`

deploymentIds.description: Export data from multiple deployments by its `deploymentIds`

includeFields.description: If these fields are set, then only they will be part of export data

excludeFields.description: Fields which will always removed from export data

deIdentifyHashFields.description: Fields which will be hashed when exporting with `"de-identify"` option

deIdentifyRemoveFields.description: Fields which will be removed when exporting with `"de-identify"` option

test journal to write something

question.example: In the last month, how frequently did you complete your scheduled medication and supplements routine?

details.example: We recognise the importance of processing and protecting your personal and health information responsibly and securely. For further information on how Huma process your personal information, please refer to Privacy Policy.

text.example: I understand that Huma will process my personal health data, including health information, as described in the Privacy Policy.

details.example: As part of this programme, you may be contacted to provide feedback on your experiences either using the HUMA app or being part of the remote patient monitoring programme.

description.example: You have a new activity for the DeTAP study. Please complete as soon as you are able to.

about.example:
For this activity, youll be asked to listen to a list of words that will be read out loud to you. Youll then say back as many words as you can remember, speaking clearly into your phones microphone. This cycle will be repeated several times. You will be provided with step-by-step instructions throughout the activity. The test is meant to be difficult and do not be alarmed if you cannot complete the full task.

This app is for research purposes only. It is not a medical device and will not provide you with any medical information. Using this app does not impact your care and should not be substituted for clinical care. If you have any concerns after participating in this research, please contact your GP.

description.example: Scroll up to change any of your answers. Changing answers may add new questions.
